attributes.action: Provide group b streptococcus leaflets with all pregnancy packs
attributes.background: Group b streptococcus  (GBS) is a normal bacterium which colonises between 20-30% of women lethel to a newborn baby when in labour if not detected and passed on from mother to a baby with a average of 80 deaths a year and long term disabilitys most though no awareness
attributes.additional_details: UK currently don't routine test for gbs and no information is giving out from health care teams I believe by putting 1 leaflet in every pregnancy pack it will definitely be read by the mother giving her a choice to test for infection privately to protect her baby awareness of this infection is extremely important

attributes.action: Request the government to press the Bangladeshi government to free Shafik Rehman
attributes.background:
Shafik Rehman, 81 has been arrested for conspiring to kill the son of the Bangladesh Prime Minister. This government have arrested several journalists on trumped up charges but never as serious or as incredible as this one. 

He is being held on remand for interrogation by the Secret Service.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Rehman, a British citizen,  has been a proponent of democracy throughout his life and to that end has written strongly against past dictators and this current government who were elected unopposed when the main opposition refused to stand in the previous election.

He is the person who introduced Valentines Day to Bangladesh, wrote a book against Capital Punishment and his investigative journalism has changed the course of Bangladesh's history.

He is a man of peace with a powerful pen.

attributes.action: Grant an amnesty to all illegal immigrants living in the UK prior to 23.06.2016.
attributes.background: Following Britain's decision to leave the EU, many people fear a significant shift to the right and violence against foreign nationals living in Britain. To prevent the victimisation of illegal immigrants by right-wing radicals, they need to have the full protection of the law as British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Illegal immigrants are already victimised in many ways, for example by being indebted to people traffickers, enslaved as sweatshop workers, and exploited as sex workers. This situation can only worsen if Britain's exit from the EU is understood as a victory for a xenophobes and racists. Granting amnesty to illegal immigrants would provide them with a way out of their current servitude and save them from the aggression of right-wing thugs.

attributes.action: Introduce the Varicella Zoster (Chickenpox) into the UK Childhood Immunisations.
attributes.background: Chickenpox is pretty much unheard of in the USA, Japan and Germany. A vaccination was approved in 1995 and has been used for 20 years. It  was combined with the MMR vaccine creating an MMRV vaccine in 2005. The World Health Organisation includes it as one of children's vital immunisations.
attributes.additional_details:
Chickenpox complications include severe skin infections, scars, brain damage and death. There is no reason children should suffer these complications when there is a safe vaccine already available. 
Studies have confirmed that the cost to the NHS would be offset by not having to deal with chickenpox complications, antibiotics prescribed, hospital, GP appointments aswell as time taken off work by parents caring for children infected with Chickenpox.

attributes.action: Make ZANU a banned political organisation in the UK & Crown territories
attributes.background: Zanu actively intimidates Zimbabwean citizens abroad by indirect means as witnessed with the Nyatsuro forced farm aquisition as reported in UK papers recently.
attributes.additional_details: Zanu has maintained the ruling party power in Zimbabwe since 1980 and created a baseless law to forcibly aquire land and property for the government. Many hundreds of thousands were fired out their homes into poverty and foreign lands. Current estimates are that over 40% of Zimbabweans live abroad. Zanu continues to intimidate, terrorise and murder families of those abroad operating with impunity in UK and Crown territories. It's time to ban them like ISIS and other hate crime supporters.

attributes.action: Five steps to strengthen multi-agency responses to 'honour'-based violence (HBV)
attributes.additional_details:
Please see these links for more details:

IKWRO press release: http://ikwro.org.uk/2016/01/iranian-kurdish-womens-rights-organisation-and-filmmaker-join-forces-to-launch-campaign-in-remembrance-of-banaz-mahmod-on-10th-anniversary-of-her-murder/

HMIC Report: https://www.justiceinspectorates.gov.uk/hmic/publications/the-depths-of-dishonour/

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies here in the UK
attributes.background: Around 50 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's one a week. As it is illegal to abandon a baby in the UK, desperate women will often leave them in areas that are cold and unsafe, that is why the UK needs a law like the Safe Haven law that is active in all 50 States in America.
attributes.additional_details:
The Safe Haven law typically allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered at a fire station, hospital or other designated place with no names taken and no questions asked. This ensures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions. 

Whilst this is a highly emotive issue and some will argue that it encourages irresponsibility, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most vulnerable.

attributes.action: To help fund Menieres Disease, by researching treatments for sufferers.
attributes.background: Ménière's disease is a rare disorder that affects the inner ear. The disease of unknown cause affecting the membranous labyrinth of the ear, causing progressive deafness and attacks of tinnitus and vertigo. I am a 21 years old Ménière's sufferer and I would appreciate support in this worthy cause.
attributes.additional_details:
Ménière’s disease is a long term, progressive condition affecting the balance and hearing parts of the inner ear. Symptoms are acute attacks of vertigo (severe dizziness), fluctuating tinnitus, increasing deafness, and a feeling of pressure in the ear.
The disease can have a huge impact to everyday activities, social/work life. Unfortunately there is not a lot of awareness for Ménière’s disease and not of research is put into this due to funds, however I would like to change this for sufferers

attributes.action: Increase university loans for art based courses.
attributes.background: Studying at university is an incredibly expensive thing to choose to do, however the added cost of buying materials and printing work for those on art-based courses means that, without extra help from family and carers, it's virtually impossible.
attributes.additional_details:
I spend hundreds of pounds a year to ensure my work is up to standard. This is not what university is about.
Your grade should not be based on how much you are able to spend on modelling materials and printing, but your actual skills.
I would like to see the student loan company take the cost of a course into account when deciding loan amounts.

attributes.action: Parliament to save the UK from breaking up by rejecting the EU referendum vote
attributes.background: The result was too close for such a major constitutional change and the consequences are far greater than people imagined.  The generation it will most affect were not all represented. 16 - 18 year olds voted in the Scottish referendum but why not in the EU referendum?

attributes.action: Recognition of Chronic Pancreatitis as a disability.
attributes.background:
Chronic Pancreatitis (CP) is a condition where the pancreas becomes permanently damaged from inflammation.

The most common symptom of Pancreatitis is repeated episodes of abdominal pain, which can be severe, Chronic Pancreatitis is a highly debilitating condition with many other complications.
attributes.additional_details:
I am issuing this petition in the hope we can change the view people have of Pancreatitis, and allow those who have a diagnosis the chance to apply for a Blue Badge.

The DWP need to be more consistent with their decision making, It's a fact that some sufferers recieve DLA/ PIP whilst others have theirs refused. It is unethical to award some and not others. Whilst we acknowledge sufferers may have differing severities and other conditions, this is not always the case when the decision is made.

attributes.action: Apologise to all ex HM Forces personnel dismissed for being gay.
attributes.background: HM Forces men and women were investigated and discharged from the Armed forces, simply for being gay. They suffered emotional, mental and material scars that still last today - homelessness, loss of friends, job and pension, rejection by family, and still no alternative career. We want an apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Apparently in 2007, an apology was issued by the MOD: http://www.theguardian.com/uk/2007/jun/28/gayrights.military. This doesn't count as an apology to those individuals. My original letter to the Guardian, 7 years ago is here: Original letter to The Guardian 7 years ago: http://gu.com/p/22k28/sbl
The Queen and the Government have so far refused to get involved. The matter was taken up in Parliament in 2015 by Paul Blomfield, MP for Sheffield Central.

attributes.action: David Cameron TO ASK Bangladesh Government about killing Opposition Politicians
attributes.background:
The British Government gives Hundreds of Millions of Pounds in Foreign Aid to the Present Bangladeshi Government every year. 
David Cameron must use this leverage to IMMEDIATELY DEMAND that Mr Motiur Rahman Nizami, a veteran Opposition Politician and the former Industries Minister, is not killed.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Poland syndrome and provide more info to those affected.
attributes.background: With our personal experience when we found out our son had Poland syndrome we found it really hard to get any information on this and also very few doctors have even heard of Poland syndrome. We feel after to speaking to others in the same position that there should be more info for us.
attributes.additional_details: Poland syndrome is a rare birth defect characterized by underdevelopment or absence of the chest pectoralis muscle and webbing of the fingers. In most individuals the missing part is the large Pectoralis muscle that attaches to the upper arm on one side and the breastbone. Abnormalities may affect muscles in the chest wall, side and shoulder and also rib cage abnormalities, Breast and nipple abnormalities may occur, may also affect internal organs.

attributes.action: Review the KS2 writing assessment criteria regarding spelling (before 30.06.16)
attributes.background: This year Y6 pupils have to meet criteria to reach the government's expected standard. All of it has to be met, as well as spelling, regardless of specific learning difficulties, including dyslexia. No matter how creative children are, they will not achieve the expected standard for their age.
attributes.additional_details:
We, as Y6 teachers, feel this will impact negatively on children's motivation to write and their self-esteem. This petition has been set up on behalf of such children who have worked hard all year, as well as parents who may not understand the consequences of this aspect of the education policy.
The government may say that children are allowed to use dictionaries, although this can stunt creativity and would not help children with spelling difficulties like dyslexia.

attributes.action: Provide an online instant-messaging alternative to phone and post with the DWP.
attributes.background:
If you can't use the phone due to hearing issues, anxiety, or processing speed, your only alternative with the DWP is postal communication. Most of us who need to do that have had their paperwork get lost.

Give us a way to communicate with the DWP in real time and save our conversation easily.
attributes.additional_details:
If you can't use the phone but have a support worker, you still need to give consent over the phone when your support worker calls them. Then there is no record of the call or what happened.

The only alternative is post, which is slow and prone to lost paperwork, requires a trip to the post office to pay for signed-for delivery for even minor communication.

Setting up a textphone system is complicated and sometimes expensive. Not everyone is able, especially if they don't have benefits yet.

attributes.action: Change the law, to set minimum prison sentences for those who abuse animals
attributes.background: The government should change the laws to set minimal prison sentences and life long bans for people convicted of animal abuse. These poor excuses of humans should be punished for their crimes rather than a 5 year ban for owning animals. Animals don't have a voice. Please be their voice and help them

attributes.action: Let members of the public be present and ask questions at PMQ'S
attributes.background: The government claims to be democratic and to represent the people, yet when do the public get to talk or ask questions to the people who are supposedly representing us? MP's frequently forget that there is a world outside of Parliaments walls. It's time the people held the government to account.

attributes.action: Launch independent UK inquiry into the Panama Papers
attributes.background: Recently leaked documents named the "Panama Papers" suggest  that people across the globe have avoided paying tax.
attributes.additional_details: Recently leaked documents named the "Panama Papers" suggest  that people across the globe have avoided paying tax.

attributes.action: Franchise to commit c2c to fast train services with stops at Southend stations
attributes.background: Timetable changes which came into force in December 2015 have led to massive overcrowding and delays to commuter journeys from Southend stations.
attributes.additional_details: Trains make more stops at London stations which means that evening commuters face travelling on dangerously packed trains. Changes to the morning timetable mean fewer trains stopping at Southend stations causing disruption and overcrowding on morning commutes. The Department for Transport must require c2c to listen to their customers and return to the original timetable. We call for the reintroduction of the old timetable which included fast services and stops at Southend stations.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of animals on classified advertising pages
attributes.background: An animal acquired via a classified ad is also highly likely to have come from a puppy farm or an unethical breeder – people who exploit animals for profit, contributing to the severe companion-animal overpopulation crisis. These animals are likely to end up in a dog baiting/fighting ring.
attributes.additional_details: Shelters across the UK are reporting a rise in the number of dogs coming through their doors, and every time someone buys a dog from a breeder or pet shop, one of these abandoned animals loses his or her chance at finding a permanent home. Every dog deserves to be more than a classified ad.

attributes.action: Condemn the Macedonian authoritarian regime that pardons organised crime.
attributes.background: Macedonia, FYR, a EU candidate country is in a political crisis caused by a corrupt authoritarian rule that has mostly been given support by the governments of the EU member states. The crisis escalated last year when the wrongdoing were revealed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 12.04.16 the president granted blanket pardon of politicians under investigation, people in Macedonia rebelled.. Police responded by beating up and arresting protesters and journalists.

The BBC has reported on the latest incidents:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-36041381

More details about the wrongdoings: the  'Priebe report' by the European commission available on
http://ec.europa.eu/enlargement/news_corner/news/news-files/20150619_recommendations_of_the_senior_experts_group.pdf

attributes.action: Vacuum Erection Devices should remain as a high priority treatment for ED
attributes.background: An increasing number of CCG's are restricting the availability of Vacuum Erection Devices as a treatment for erectile dysfunction on community FP10 prescription by listing it as a "low priority" treatment against the grain of clinical evidence and recommendation by Urological Consultant Specialists
attributes.additional_details: Numerous published studies exist supporting the use of VED's as a safe, effective and high compliance treatment for erectile dysfunction of all aetiologies and as a penile rehabilitation tool post pelvic cancer treatment eg prostatectomy. Supported also by organisations such as the British Society of Sexual Medicine, MacMillan and Prostate Cancer UK, and sexual health specialists across the UK. Low cost option with up to a 5 year warranty with no effective restriction on frequency of use.

attributes.action: Change regulations for fathers who lose a child to stillbirth or neonatal death
attributes.background: Currently if a fathers child dies due to stillbirth or neonatal death they are only entitled to what their employer feels is required in terms of compassionate leave.  While a mother is fully entitled and rightly so to the full maternity leave.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the father should be entitled to take and or share the maternity leave with his partner. These are extreme circumstances and should be looked at as such. When it comes to dealing with the death of a child, your gender does not come in to it. I am writing from personal experience as my son Zachary was stillborn at 11 days overdue on April 2nd 2013.
I was treated extremely badly and inappropriately by my employer after having sick leave due to the death if my son.

attributes.action: Save the Environment Land Based Science (ELBS) GCSE from ending in 2018.
attributes.background: Please do not let this generation suffer and the rural sector miss out from this damaging decision. ELBS is a fantastic course for secondary education to offer especially in rural areas, developing the next generation and inspiring teenagers to live and work in the rural community or animal care.
attributes.additional_details: Our school in Kingsteignton Devon has had a farm since 2009 offering this land based science course. Many of our students at Teign School live in the rural community this has been a huge asset in education. As well as offering students GCSEs Rydon Primary school also visit for educating younger children reaching out to over 1600 students. Our farm will now have to close due to this decision, it will have devastating impact throughout education and the local communities. Together we're stronger.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum exclusively for 16 and 17-year olds.
attributes.background: The results of this second vote would be folded into the results of  the  general referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that the outcome of the European Union referendum will impact the younger generations for decades to come, and that 16 and 17-years old were denied the right to have a say in spite of having to bear the economic and political brunt of this decision, we propose that a second referendum be held exclusively for them. 
We also propose that the results of this second referendum be included with the results of the general referendum as a more accurate representation of the public will regarding membership of the E.U.

attributes.action: Ban the practice of Halal and Kosher slaughter in the UK
attributes.background: This petition believes that there is no place for the barbaric process of inhumane slaughter of livestock on religious grounds. Animals reared for meat for human consumption deserve the methods of slaughter which cause the least amount of suffering possible.

attributes.action: Set one day a year as Forces recognition and Covenant Day.
attributes.background: We Veterans and supporting civilians feel that a special day. would increase the understanding  between   active service persons, cadets, veterans, and the civilian population of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
The day could be used country wide for
1    Public relations activities.
2    Military meet the people events.
3    Veterans  in the schools.
4    Covenant Representatives inform the public about their activities.
5    Corps, and Regimental associations inform about their activities in helping serving, and veteran service persons.

And many more such activities, informing the general public  about the quality of our Armed Forces, its Veterans, the Cadet Forces, and the supporting civilian workers. Which we know is second too none.

attributes.action: Delay EU exit until referendum campaigns are fully investigated for truthfulness
attributes.background:
The recent referendum was characterised by lies and twisted truth, with newspaper retractions and fact-finding services being needed daily.

We need to know whether the British public were deliberately misled, by whom, and by how much, before committing to this monumental decision.

attributes.action: Give Ministers for 'Out' in the referendum equal access to the Civil Service.
attributes.background: Number 10 has announced that unequal treatment for Ministers on either side of the referendum campaign. This is manifestly unfair and undemocratic. All Ministers should receive equal treatment.

attributes.action: Keep university bursaries for student nurses
attributes.background: The U.K. Government is planning to scrap maintenance grants and bursaries that many trainee nurses rely on to get through their valued education.  In place of the grants and bursaries, the government plan to change them into student loans.
attributes.additional_details:
Newly qualified nurses that do an extremely valuable job, are starting their careers with huge training debts which accrue interest, will be paying for their whole careers.

This is a disgraceful treatment of the future generations of NHS staff and should be scrapped.

attributes.action: On BREXIT British expatriates should retain their healthcare within the EU
attributes.background: As part of the Brexit negotiations the UK Government should ensure that British expatriates who were residents of other EU countries at the time of the Referendum vote, should retain their rights to healthcare in their countries of residency.
attributes.additional_details:
Many British expatriates living in the EU are elderly, in need of regular healthcare and living on a fixed income. 
If they lose the right to use the health system within the countries in which they are domiciled they will inevitably either have to take out expensive health insurance that they can ill afford or return to the UK for treatment, adding further pressure on an already overburdened NHS.
Expats who were residents of other EU nations at the time of the Referendum should retain their right to healthcare in those countries.

attributes.action: Repeal the Housing & Planning Act passed in May 2016.
attributes.background: In times of increasing job insecurity & homelessness, instead of building much-needed council & social housing to create homes and jobs, this Act forces the sale of council homes, prohibits the building of new council homes, allows councils to sell off council estates and ends security of tenure.
attributes.additional_details:
It also forces existing council tenants earning above a certain amount to pay rent at inflated, unregulated market prices and extends the right to buy to Housing Association tenants, thereby greatly reducing the country's stock of homes to let at a reasonable rent.
This Act will exacerbate the hardships suffered by the most vulnerable who will be forced into costly and unstable private rented accommodation and will place many more in a vulnerable, insecure situation for the first time.

attributes.action: Call for a second EU referendum as the first did not have a clear mandate.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is an irrevocable decision, which will have far reaching consequences. Due to this we must only leave if there is a clear mandate from the people, which does not exist at present since 48% voted IN. It is vital that there is a second referendum and that a clear mandate is reached.

attributes.action: A second EU referendum including 16 and 17 year olds
attributes.background:
A second EU should be taken & open to 16 and 17 year olds. This vote has been much too close and doesn't take into consideration young people who will be most affected.
Fear mongering in the media has warped facts. The drop in value of the GBP (£) should be reason enough to revote with young people

attributes.action: I want my mum to stay in the UK although she doesn't have a permanent visa.
attributes.background: In August my family visited the UK to meet my sick grandfather. We realised he was dying from Parkinsons and decided to stay and look after him, however, my mum had a visit visa and the government wouldn't change it. The government is forcing my mum to leave me, my sister and my dad. Please help us.
attributes.additional_details: Parkinson's disease is a degenerative disease meaning every time I visit my granddad he loses his memory even more. My family and I decided to stay in the UK so we could spend the most amount of time as a family with my granddad. However, my mum has a visit visa and that doesn't allow her to stay with me. That means we have have to leave my dying granddad to stay with my mum or my mum has to leave us for a minimum of a year. That is very stressful because I love both my granddad and mum.

attributes.action: Review planning policy and it's interpretation at local level
attributes.background: Oakland employs 245 and is recognised as a top 100 local employer and also in the top 1000 companies to Inspire Britain. Bromsgrove Council stated that further building on Oakland’s site is not welcome, commenting Oakland is “growing like topsy” and have asked Oakland to relocate out of the county.
attributes.additional_details:
Oakland is seeing its whole existence under threat due to its local Council blocking any building plans.

The Council’s planners argument for refusal is based on protection of Green Belt, in this case derelict warehouses.

Oakland is intent on highlighting the disparity between what Central Government is saying and what Local Government is doing.

To understand better our situation please follow the link www.plannersblockbusiness.co.uk and watch some of our videos to understand our frustrations.

attributes.action: Change planning laws so all New House Builds must have hedgehog holes in fences
attributes.background:
Hedgehogs are in serious decline in the UK, urban gardens are a vital lifeline. Creating a hedgehog hole in a fence allows hedgehogs to pass from garden to garden without having to cross any roads.
A change to planning would require access for hedgehogs in all new house build garden fencing
attributes.additional_details: Details of the plight of hedgehogs can be found at the Hedgehog Preservation Society http://www.britishhedgehogs.org.uk/pdf/SoBH_2015.pdf

attributes.action:
Ban supermarkets from throwing away/ spoiling unsold food.
Lets feed the needy!
attributes.background: Supermarkets in France have been banned from throwing away or spoiling unsold food by law. Let's implement same in the UK and feed the needy!

attributes.action: Following EU Referendum, Brexit team to be formed from elected MEPs and MPs.
attributes.background: Most of our elected MPs do not understand the anti-democratic EU (or they would have campaigned for Leave). MEPs know its structures and the legislation we may be pushed to accept part of. In the national interest any legitimate Brexit negotiation team must comprise our elected MEPs and MPs.

attributes.action: Allergen and nutrition information to be provided by all food establishments.
attributes.background: Since December 2014 it has been made a necessity that 14 indetified food allergens including nuts, fish, milk and eggs must be provided on food packaging and on menus where food packaging isn't readily available (Food Standards Agency, 2013). However this doesn't cover the full nutritional content.
attributes.additional_details:
I myself have been a type 1 insulin-dependent diabetic for 16 years, and as part of my condition management I, like thousands of others, need to know the nutrition, particularly carbohydrate content of the foods I am eating in order to calculate my insulin requirements.

Diabetes is a life-threatening chronic health condition and it is extremely surprising how many food establishments are only able to provide allergen information and not the full nutritional content of the items on their menus.

attributes.action: For Jeremy Hunt NOT to impose the new junior doctor contracts.
attributes.background: We do not need a 7 day NHS at the expense of losing good doctors to the private sector or overseas or due to an even bigger gap i work life balance. This government was not elected because of their promise of a 7 day NHS. They were elected because there was no one better at the time.

attributes.action: Switch the UK voting system from FPTP to single transferable vote.
attributes.background: Switch to the STV voting which sees voters rank their candidates in order of preference (e.g. 1-5). This voting system removes minority rule in constituencies and tactical voting and gives us a fairer representation for smaller parties instead of just Labour or the Tories.
attributes.additional_details: The 2015 General Election gave Britain the most unrepresentative results in recent memory. SNP and Lib Dems had a smaller percentage of the vote than UKIP but achieved 62 seats (combined). The Labour and the Tories had a 3% difference in the vote, but a near 100 seat difference. How is it fair that the Lib Dems get 4% less of the vote than UKIP but 7 more seats? Or that SNP get even less votes than the Lib Dems but eight times the seats? This is a broken system that needs to be fixed by STV.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to wear a helmet on trikes and quad bikes
attributes.background: I was in a trike crash which killed my boyfriend, who was driving. I woke up in hospital with serious injuries and two policeman by my bed. They said wearing a helmet on a trike was not a legal requirement. But I don't want anyone else to go through what myself, my boyfriend and our families have.
attributes.additional_details:
Helmets are only compulsory for motor bicycles, not motor tricycles.

Motor Cycles (Protective Helmets) Regulations 1988. 
Statutory Instrument 1998 No 1807.

attributes.action: Make the next Ofsted chief work as a classroom teacher for a term
attributes.background: The next proposed chief inspector of Ofsted, Amanda Spielman, should spend at least a term working as a classroom teacher prior to taking up the position. Someone who tells others how to teach and run education must come from a position of experience of doing the job.

attributes.action: A Bill for The Protection, Breeding Limitation and Monitoring Law for Canines
attributes.background:
We are calling on David Cameron to make additions in the current law to protect the welfare/safety and breeding limitations of Canines.
Dogs should be given the care/respect they deserve and treated respectfully. 
For far too long they have been seen as a way of making profit and mistreated.

attributes.action: Make staff happiness an inspection criteria for Ofsted.
attributes.background: It's largely written about in media and social blogs that teaching is one of the most stressful jobs of today. Whilst the personal and academic needs of young people, and the measurable success of schools, are demanded and pressurised, the health and well being of staff seems to diminish.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been proposed to emphasise the need for a long term solution for the drop out rates of new teachers, the number of medical absences as a result of stress or depression and the many untold stories of teachers who battle on with the mounting pressure and challenge that teaching brings everyday. 

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/31/four-in-10-new-teachers-quit-within-a-year

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-31921457

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens voting rights in a second EU referendum
attributes.background: Many UK citizens living outside the UK were not eligible to vote in the EU referendum held on June 23, 2016. This was inappropriate and unjust as British membership of the EU has a direct impact on these citizens. In a second referendum, all UK citizens must have the right to vote.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens living outside the UK for more than 15 years did not have the right to vote in the first EU referendum of June 23, 2016.

attributes.action: Make LAs fund parental chosen legal representation at SEND appeals
attributes.background: LAs are increasingly instructing expensive, external legal firms to represent them at SEND tribunals.  Often this will be a barrister, regardless of whether the parents of the disabled child is represented.  Tribunals are meant to be light touch, and families are not being given a fair hearing.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are at breaking point, constantly fighting for their disabled childrens' educational rights, while LAs spare no expense to 'win' tribunal claims.  
http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/09687590701259674?journalCode=

https://onedrive.live.com/redir?page=view&resid=3EA9503A53A03A77!230&authkey=!APLwZXHPVC_Xem8
To redress this imbalance, LAs should either not be allowed to instruct external legal representation, or if they do, they should fund legal representation of parents choice.

attributes.action: Move PM Questions to Saturdays.
attributes.background: Live televised parliament could have a far wider audience because the majority of people in work or education are working on Wednesdays at noon and have to rely on edited soundbites in news reports.
